title: GM to invest $100 million to upgrade facilities to build self-driving cars
text: March 15, 2018 / 3:38 PM / Updated 7 minutes ago GM to invest $100 million to upgrade facilities to build self-driving cars   WASHINGTON (Reuters) - General Motors Co ( GM.N ) said Thursday it will invest more than $100 million in two facilities as it prepares to build production versions of its Cruise self-driving car next year at its Orion Township assembly plant in Michigan. FILE PHOTO - The GM logo is seen at the General Motors Lansing Grand River Assembly Plant in Lansing, Michigan October 26, 2015. Photo taken October 26. REUTERS/Rebecca Cook The largest U.S. automaker also said roof modules for GM’s self-driving vehicles will be assembled at its Brownstown Battery Assembly plant. In January, GM filed a petition seeking U.S. government approval for a fully autonomous car - one without a steering wheel, brake pedal or accelerator pedal - to enter the automaker’s first commercial ride-sharing fleet in 2019. Reporting by David Shepardson; Editing by Nick Zieminski
